content.description: This is a great and steep route that climbs throughout the steepest part of the cliff.  Positive holds and a surprising amount of feet make the climb enjoyable!
content.protection: Top rope off of trees.  Lots of webbing or cord needed.
content.location: The route is located at the tall section of cliff with a roof just a minute or two from the road. Climb the corner and up to the left of the old nest.  Traversing in from the left on a ramp system can be fun.  When your feet are level with the nest, traverse a little right on hand holds and then up.  Be careful of the large block left of the nest.  It is a little loose and may need to be removed.

content.description: Starts of the short section of vertical rock and then goes into the left facing corner on the right.
content.protection: Lots of webbing or cord for a TR anchor off of trees.
content.location: Located to the right of the roofs and to the right of Ixodes.  Shares the same start as Ixodes.

content.description: This route starts up  some vertical rock to the low angle rock and traverses left to the right facing corner.  If rock climbing on top rope , continue up a little to the right of the crack in the corner.  If drytooling, the first half of the climb is a little strange for tools and goes at maybe D4.  The upper section is much more interesting as you can get great torques in the corner and goes at D7.
content.protection: Lots of webbing or cord to make a TR off of trees.
content.location: Located to the right of the roofs and to the left of Scapularis that shares the same start.

content.description: Follow Large crack from arrow to star on picture. Access top from the left
content.protection: 20 foot distances from boulders and large White Pine top rope anchors. Trad possibilities present
content.location: Ist 40+ ft route on left of cliff face ,approach base from far left and follow shelf.

content.description: A fun face climb that skirts left of all the roofs.
content.protection: Lots of webbing or cord for an anchor on top.
content.location: Located to the left of the roofs.

content.description: Dry-Tool Cliff is the farthest East area of Section 18.More to follow
